data.title: Dispensarius Magistri Nicolai, Prepositi ad...
data.meta_description: Auction, in Spain: Large 4º (25 x 17. 3 cm.) 105 folio sheets, including the title page with a woodcut in the centre. Two-column print, 54...
data.text:
[ translate ]

Large 4º (25 x 17. 3 cm.) 105 folio sheets, including the title page with a woodcut in the centre. Two-column print, 54 lines per page, in Gothic script, wood engraved initials, marginal notes. Recovered 18th century parchment, renovated flyleaves. Second edition of this very early pharmacopoeia compiled by the doctor of Tours, Nicolás Prevost, with all the recipes and antidotes used at the time. The first edition saw the light in 1488 and is considered the first antidotary ever published. Handwritten note from the 16th century on the title page: ‘El doctor g. calico. ’ Water stains, more pronounced on the first and lasts sheets. On the edge, antique tint: dispensarius nicolai.
